intro: Diplusodon helianthemifolius, commonly known as the sunflower-leaved diplusodon, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun, showcasing its sunflower-like foliage. Its leaves are narrow and arranged in a rosette pattern, while the flowers are small and yellow, forming dense clusters. It is often used in rock gardens due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
